      boolean Actions.levelTooLow()
      Returns true if the dam's current water level is less than its minimum operating threshold.
      java.lang.Integer Log.variation()
      Returns the numerical difference between the most recent and oldest entries in the log.

      void LogTests.testVariationOne()

      void LogTests.testVariationSeven()

      void LogTests.testVariationThrowException()
      Tests WaterLog.Variaton()'s throw exception which is if you use Variation() on a log with 0 entries
      void LogTests.testVariationTwo()
      Tests WaterLog.variation() to see if it can return 0, the correct amount for a water log with 7 entries (all the same) and window of 7
      java.lang.Integer WaterLog.variation() 
      Constructors in asgn1Solution that throw SimulationException 
      Constructor and Description
      DamActions(java.lang.Integer damCapacity, java.lang.Integer defaultRelease, java.lang.Integer jobDuration, WaterLog damLog)
      A DamActions can store all the necessary values to run a dam, it is an object that holds the dam's capacity, how much water it will release by default, how long the manager is going to work for, and the log of water levels for the specified amount of days.
      WaterLog(java.lang.Integer windowSize, java.lang.Integer maxEntry)
      A WaterLog class is used to hold a log of the dam's water levels over the past specified amount of days.
